issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Appcelerator Modules
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Modules here.

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

fields.description:
I have a need to create a Mobile Module Project for Windows 10, I clicked the New Mobile Module option and the dialog returned only offers the option to create a module for Android or Mobile Web, Windows is not listed.

Screenshot attached.

!module.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot Create Mobile Module Project for Windows

comments.body: Hello, Can you run on the Windows simulator or device? Make sure you have all the requirement for Windows module development according to the guide here: http://docs.appcelerator.com/platform/latest/#!/guide/Windows_Module_Quick_Start. let us know. Thanks.

I tried the CLI,  It tried to create a module, but failed. Following the Appcelerator guide command line call there is no option to select the module target platform. It  tries to create a blank module for all  platforms.  This fails and complains "TypeError: Invalid Version: android.0.0".  This is annoying as this box has a valid Android SDK & NDK installed, I use this box for native Android development & I don't want a Titanium Android module. I recall that Titanium for Android requires an old obsolete SDK, do I have to install that to create a Windows module?
Hello, Can you run "appc info" and attach the log as a text file in here. Thanks.

I got it to work, it turned out that Titanium can't see my Android SDK because it is on the D: drive.  This is ridiculous, to develop a Windows module I have to put the Android SDK on my C: drive creating GB's of clutter when I don't need it and have a complete functioning native Android development setup already installed on my D: drive.
